Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.4: AMENDMENT SEQUENCE NUMBER: used to order amendment events forproduction volumes. For each PDEN, volume method, acitivity type, period type andvolume date, the first row is 0. Subsequent rows are sequenced by 1, so that the fullamendment history may be recreated. When supporting amendments, rows areusually not editable once entered. Instead, new rows are created that track theamended record.
Column Comment.5: PERIOD_TYPE: The type of period measured, such as hourly, daily, weekly etc.
Column Comment.6: OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique number added to a PK, in which order does notmatter, or where date or some other value is used to determine order. Use theArchitectural Principle to assign.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: PDEN AMENDMENT REASON: The reason why a production amendment wasposted, such as instrument calibration, calculation error or volume balancing.
Column Comment.9: CASING PRESSURE: The pressure measured in the casing. This is the pressuremeasured between the casing and tubing at the wellhead.
Column Comment.10: CASING PRESSURE OUOM: Casing pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: CHOKE POSITION: position of the choke
Column Comment.12: CHOKE SIZE: Inner diameter of the choke. A choke is a valve or an orifice used torestrict or control the rate of flow.
Column Comment.13: CHOKE SIZE OUOM: Choke size original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE: The difference of the pressure on the upstream andthe downstream sides of an orifice or choke.
Column Comment.15: DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE OUOM: Differential pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.16: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.17: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.18: FLOW RATE: The volume of fluid per unit time.
Column Comment.19: FLOW RATE OUOM: Flow rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: MEASUREMENT DATE: The date that the flow measurement was taken.
Column Comment.21: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.22: MEASUREMENT TIME: the time of day that the measurement was made
Column Comment.23: MEASUREMENT TIMEZONE: the timezone referencing the time of day. If time iscaptured, this column is mandatory.
Column Comment.24: MEASUREMENT TYPE: Identifies the type of measurement recorded.
Column Comment.25: MEASUREMENT TEMPERATURE: The fluid temperature at the time the flow measurement was made.
Column Comment.26: MEASURED TEMPERATURE OUOM: Measured temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: POSTED DATE: The date that this volume was posted, not necessarily the samedate as the volume is loaded into the database. This date is used to determine whennew volumes, such as amendments, were added to the database.
Column Comment.28: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.29: PRODUCTION VOLUME: The measured volume of production.
Column Comment.30: PRODUCTION VOLUME OUOM: Production volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.32: PRODUCTION TIME ELAPSED: The duration that the production flow has beenmeasured.
Column Comment.33: PRODUCTION TIME ELAPSED OUOM: Production time original unit of measure.
Column Comment.34: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.35: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.36: STATIC PRESSURE: Pressure exerted on the fluid measured after the well has beenshutin for a period of time and the maximum pressure has been built up.
Column Comment.37: STATIC PRESSURE OUOM: Static pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.38: TUBING PRESSURE: The measured pressure within the tubing.
Column Comment.39: TUBING PRESSURE OUOM: Tubing pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.41: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.43: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.46: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
